snippet: Buildings by Wang Shu, the first Chinese architect to win the Pritzker prize, often recall nature, fusing old-world Chinese and modern idioms.
abstract: Pritzker Prize-winning architect Wang Shu strongly disagrees with the rush to urbanization in his native China; designs buildings that recall older aspects of Chinese culture and are made from simple and inexpensive materials.
lead_paragraph: Buildings by Wang Shu, the first Chinese architect to win the Pritzker prize, often recall nature, fusing old-world Chinese and modern idioms.

headline.seo: Wang Shu of China Advocates Sustainable Architecture
headline.main: An Architect’s Vision: Bare Elegance in China
